TopicTitle: Probably the best PAK-FA T-50 made so far

Articles.Content:
Again, another 'probably the best .... made so far' (i know it sounds arrogant as **** but i searched around and couldn't find a better one in terms of looks, anytime that happens i name the thread that way.) thread, enjoy.

Still need some things to tweak such as the shape of the front, it feels a bit.. unnatural..
Looks good, but it's not too impressive. I find that making a flyable stock replica of something like this shows a lot more skill.

Looks good, but it's not too impressive. I find that making a flyable stock replica of something like this shows a lot more skill.

Indeed it is, but i wanted to go for a full replica and not some tail fin monster on steroids

Looks good, but it's not too impressive. I find that making a flyable stock replica of something like this shows a lot more skill.

I don't know what you're talking about. I think this thing is impressive. The time and effort that went into this is impressive. And to add insult to injury, it looks like it would work in FAR. Which is far better than anything made in the stock KSP, you can make a brick outhouse fly without engines in the stock KSP.

front end of the wind screen needs to be elongated a bit so that the base of the nose is narrower. Also the nose needs to be pointier. Looks good though. I wouldn't have even noticed the "unnatural" look to the front end if you hadn't pointed it out
This is a really awesome plane and some great 3D modeling skills.. but.. the title of this thread just seems kinda... Arrogant.
The vertical tails should be moved a little bit forward as well but other than that... Great job

look at my reply on STOCK

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51748-KSP-Replicas-%28neXus74%29

I don't know what you're talking about. I think this thing is impressive. The time and effort that went into this is impressive. And to add insult to injury, it looks like it would work in FAR. Which is far better than anything made in the stock KSP, you can make a brick outhouse fly without engines in the stock KSP.

This was actually made with FAR

This is a really awesome plane and some great 3D modeling skills.. but.. the title of this thread just seems kinda... Arrogant.

Waaay ahead of you (read the first sentence of the OP ;P)

look at my reply on STOCK

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51748-KSP-Replicas-%28neXus74%29

Very impressive, the way you made it possible to yaw-spin like the real one can is amazing, really well done
Tried to make a good nose but i'm just crap at it, some help would be greatly appreciated ^^

I love the Pak-fa design (really resembles a yf-23 and the f-22). Those engines though... They want a stealth aircraft, you have to hide your biggest heat producer. Granted, it's still a prototype and they could be working on it's actual engine design, but come-on ...oO...

I love the Pak-fa design (really resembles a yf-23 and the f-22). Those engines though... They want a stealth aircraft, you have to hide your biggest heat producer. Granted, it's still a prototype and they could be working on it's actual engine design, but come-on ...oO...

Haha, exactly my thoughts when i first laid eyes upon this beauty
